markdown:
Hungry and resentful, the malevolent kuns are mythological fish monsters that dwell in the remotest, coldest depths of the ocean. These massively powerful creatures could easily rule a subaquatic domain if they cared to, but kuns are also famous for their total self-absorption and complete ambivalence toward other forms of life. Kuns remain as far away from other creatures as they can, subsisting on only their own icy hatred. They can consume and digest prey, but such feedings are incidental or driven more by spite than any physical need. Most kuns remain ignorant and uncaring, keeping themselves in the dark and disregarding any signs of life around them except to occasionally lash out when disturbed. The kun hunts at the bottom of the cold, dark sea. But if shown the light of the sun, a kun begins to understand that it dwells within a different, bigger world. When flocks of birds or schools of fish cast their dappled shadows upon a kun, they might grow weary of their solitude or become curious about the realm above. **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Kun](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2774) **Source** [Tian Xia World Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=223) pg. 289 **Perception** +27; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=59), [light blindness](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=68), [wavesense](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=84) 60 feet **Languages** [Thalassic](/Languages.aspx?ID=113); (can't speak any language) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +29, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +22, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +25 **Str** +8 **Dex** +4 **Con** +7 **Int** +1 **Wis** +5 **Cha** +4 --- **AC** 36 **Fort** +29 **Ref** +24 **Will** +23 **HP** 230 **Resistances** cold 10 **Weaknesses** holy 10 **Spite** **Trigger** A creature within reach of the kun's tail uses an action to heal or help anyone else **Effect** The kun bats the triggering creature away with their tail, making a tail Strike against the creature. On a hit, the action is disrupted and the creature is pushed 10 feet.
 --- **Speed** swim 40 feet **Melee** jaws +28 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+14 piercing plus [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=45) and heart of darkness **Melee** tail +28 ([reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Sweep](/Traits.aspx?ID=194)), **Damage** 3d12+14 bludgeoning **Primal Innate Spells** DC 32 - **5th** [Control Water](/Spells.aspx?ID=51) (at will) - **7th** [Darkness](/Spells.aspx?ID=59) (at will), [Wall of Ice](/Spells.aspx?ID=364) **Funnel** ([Cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134), [Water](/Traits.aspx?ID=165)) The kun inhales violently, sucking in heat and all creatures in the water in a 60-foot cone. Creatures take 10d8 cold damage and must attempt a DC 33 Fortitude save. The kun can't Funnel again for 1d4 rounds. **Critical Success** The creature is unaffected.
**Success** The creature takes half damage.
**Failure** The creature takes full damage and is pulled 30 feet toward the kun.
**Critical Failure** The creature takes double damage and is pulled 60 feet toward the kun. **Heart of Darkness** Whenever the kun makes a jaws Strike from within an area of darkness, their jaws deals an additional 2d6 spirit damage and gains the unholy trait. **[Swallow Whole](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=77)** ([Attack](/Traits.aspx?ID=15)) Huge, 3d12+7 bludgeoning, Rupture 30
Change of Heart In extremely rare circumstances and for their own mysterious reasons, a kun might sacrifice some of their power to undergo a permanent, onetime transformation. In a final dramatic act, the kun flings themself up and out of the ocean, allowing the sun to fully wash over them. In the process, the kun transforms from a hateful fish into a noble and curious bird called a [peng](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2780)
